example1_sleep_supplements.user_message: I have trouble sleeping. What supplements might help?

expected_response.greeting: I understand how frustrating sleep troubles can be üò¥ Let me help you find natural supplements that can improve your sleep quality.

actionItems.title: Magnesium for Better Sleep üåô
actionItems.content: Magnesium glycinate is one of the most effective supplements for sleep. It helps relax muscles and calm the nervous system. Take 200-400mg about 30 minutes before bed.

actionItems.title: Melatonin for Sleep Regulation ‚è∞
actionItems.content: Melatonin helps regulate your sleep-wake cycle. Start with a low dose (1-3mg) taken 1-2 hours before bed. It's especially helpful for jet lag or shift work.

actionItems.title: L-Theanine for Relaxation üçµ
actionItems.content: Found in green tea, L-theanine promotes relaxation without drowsiness. Take 100-200mg before bed, often combined with magnesium for better effects.

expected_response.additionalInformation: Always start with the lowest effective dose and consult your healthcare provider if you take other medications.

actionableItems.title: Buy Magnesium Glycinate
actionableItems.description: High-absorption magnesium for better sleep and muscle relaxation
actionableItems.reason: Helps relax muscles and calm nervous system for better sleep

actionableItems.title: Buy Melatonin
actionableItems.description: Natural sleep hormone to regulate sleep-wake cycle
actionableItems.reason: Helps you fall asleep faster and stay asleep longer

actionableItems.title: Track Your Sleep Supplements
actionableItems.description: Add your supplements to pantry for personalized tracking
actionableItems.suggestedNotes: Track which supplements work best for your sleep

actionableItems.title: Create Sleep Wellness Routine üåô
actionableItems.description: Build a personalized bedtime routine with supplement timing

questions: How long have you been experiencing sleep issues?
Do you have trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or both?
Are you taking any medications that might interact with supplements?

example2_have_supplement.user_message: I have magnesium but not sure when to take it

expected_response.greeting: Great that you already have magnesium! üíä Let me help you use it effectively for better sleep.

actionItems.title: Optimal Magnesium Timing üïê
actionItems.content: Take your magnesium 30-60 minutes before bed. This gives it time to be absorbed and start promoting relaxation. Take with a small snack if it upsets your stomach.

actionItems.title: Dosage Guidelines üíä
actionItems.content: Start with 200mg and increase to 400mg if needed. Magnesium glycinate or citrate are best for sleep. Too much can cause digestive issues, so increase gradually.

expected_response.additionalInformation: Consistency is key - take magnesium at the same time each night for best results.

actionableItems.title: Add Magnesium to Your Pantry
actionableItems.description: Track your magnesium intake and effects on sleep
actionableItems.suggestedNotes: Take 200-400mg, 30-60 minutes before bed. Monitor sleep quality.

actionableItems.title: Create Bedtime Routine with Magnesium üåô
actionableItems.description: Build a routine that includes proper supplement timing

questions: What type of magnesium do you have (glycinate, citrate, oxide)?
What dose is each capsule or tablet?
Have you noticed any effects when you've taken it before?

example3_pain_supplements.user_message: What natural supplements help with chronic pain and inflammation?

expected_response.greeting: I understand dealing with chronic pain is challenging üíù Here are evidence-based natural supplements that can help reduce inflammation and manage pain.

actionItems.title: Turmeric/Curcumin Power üåü
actionItems.content: Curcumin is a powerful anti-inflammatory. Take 500-1000mg twice daily with black pepper (piperine) for better absorption. Best taken with meals containing healthy fats.

actionItems.title: Omega-3 for Inflammation üêü
actionItems.content: Fish oil reduces inflammatory markers. Take 2-3g daily of EPA/DHA combined. Choose high-quality, purified fish oil to avoid contaminants.

actionItems.title: Boswellia for Joint Health üåø
actionItems.content: This herb specifically helps with joint pain and arthritis. Take 300-500mg of standardized extract 2-3 times daily with food.

expected_response.additionalInformation: These supplements work best when combined with anti-inflammatory diet and gentle movement.

actionableItems.title: Buy Turmeric Curcumin Complex
actionableItems.reason: Reduces inflammation and helps manage chronic pain naturally

actionableItems.title: Buy Omega-3 Fish Oil
actionableItems.description: Essential fatty acids for inflammation control
actionableItems.reason: Reduces inflammatory markers and supports joint health

actionableItems.reason: Specifically targets joint inflammation and pain

example4_tracking_medications.user_message: I take ibuprofen and tylenol for my back pain

expected_response.greeting: I see you're managing back pain with over-the-counter medications üíä Let me help you track these safely and explore complementary approaches.

actionItems.title: Safe Medication Tracking üìã
actionItems.content: Track your medications to avoid exceeding daily limits: Ibuprofen max 1200mg/day, Tylenol max 3000mg/day. Space doses at least 4-6 hours apart.

actionItems.title: Complement with Natural Options üåø
actionItems.content: Consider adding topical arnica gel or heat/cold therapy between medication doses. This can reduce your need for oral pain relievers.

expected_response.additionalInformation: Long-term NSAID use can affect stomach and kidneys. Consider discussing alternatives with your doctor.

actionableItems.title: Add Ibuprofen to Pantry
actionableItems.description: Track your pain medication usage safely
actionableItems.suggestedNotes: Max 1200mg/day. Take with food. Track doses and pain levels.

actionableItems.title: Add Tylenol to Pantry
actionableItems.suggestedNotes: Max 3000mg/day. Can take every 4-6 hours. Track effectiveness.

actionableItems.title: Create Back Pain Management Plan üéØ
actionableItems.description: Combine medication tracking with stretches, heat therapy, and natural supplements

actionableItems.title: Consider Natural Pain Relief
actionableItems.searchQuery: arnica gel extra strength back pain
